title: The human-computer technology group at Bellcore
proctitle: CHI '92: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

references.text: Bush, R.M. (1990). Putting the Human in Human/Computer Interaction. In Proceedings of National Communications Forum, 44. Chicago: Professional Education International.

Dayton, J. T. (1991). Cultivated eclecticism as the Normative Approach to design. In J. Karat (Ed.), Taking Software Design Seriously: Practical Techniques for Human-Computer Interaction Design. Boston: Academic Press.
Muller, M. J. (1991). PICTIVE - Democratizing the Dynamics of the Design Session. In Proceedings ofCHI'91, New Orleans, April 1991.
Muller, M. J. (1992). Retrospective on a Year of Participatory Design using the PICTIVE Technique. To appear in Proceedings of CHl '92, Monterey CA, May 1992.
Muller, M.J., Wildman, D.M., and White, E.A. (1992). Taxonomy ofParticipatory Design Practices: A Participatory Poster. Poster submitted to CHI'92, Monterey CA, May 1992.

Nielsen, J., Bush'R'M" Dayt~n'J'T" M~nd' N'E" Muller' M.J., & Root, R.W. (1992). Teaching Experienced Developers to Design Graphical User Interfaces. To appear in Proceedings of CHI'92, Monterey CA, May 1992.
Smith, J.(3., and Cebulka, K.D. (1991). A Framework for Intelligent interfaces. Poster at CHI'91, New Orleans, April 1991.
Smith, J. G. & Dayton, J. T. (1992). Empirical Support for the Utility of User Models. Submitted to User Modeling and User-Adapted Interaction.
Smith, J.G., Miller, D.S., and Muller, M.J. (1992). TelePICTIVE Groupware for Collaborative GUI Design. Poster submitted to CHI'92, Monterey CA, May 1992.
